p:
All putative markers were tested individually. Whereas β-pinene had a positive regression coefficient, this compound was not considered further because it was found to be inactive according to endpoint criteria proposed by Cos et al. and Gertsch et al.
32, 33 , exhibiting a MIC > 64 µg/mL when concurrently tested as a pure compound. The positive coefficient of β-pinene in the OPLS model coefficient-plot evidently originated from its presence in a large relative proportion (6.7 and 14.9%) in moderately active Pimenta racemosa EOs (antifungal scores of 4–5), along with approximately 60% of eugenol. β-Pinene was also present in many inactive essential oils, although always in a proportion below 6%. Overall, this explains why its regression coefficient was positive, and why β-pinene was excluded from the list of active metabolites.
